response:
MRI is the gold standard to visualise demyelinating plaques and confirm dissemination in space and time. Blood, urine, and CSF analyses are required to rule out infection, differentiate between demyelinating subtypes (NMO/MOG), and confirm intrathecal antibody synthesis.

investigations = ["MRI of brain and whole spine with contrast", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Liver function tests", "Thyroid function tests", "Vitamin B12 and folate", "Blood glucose", "Anti-AQP4 antibodies", "Anti-MOG antibodies", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ENA)", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology", "Lumbar puncture for CSF analysis (Oligoclonal bands)", "Visual Evoked Potentials", "Urine culture and sensitivity"]
